plugins.name: Turtles
plugins.description:
Turtles is a simple utility to that selects every layer under your selected layer. When working on mobile UI this is a cumbersome task. No more!


  1. Select a layer
  2. Run "Turtles"
  3. You're done! Everything below is selected ✌️
plugins.tagline: Select "All The Way Down

plugins.name: DATVM
plugins.description:
DATVM makes it simple to inject realistic and varied data directly into your Figma designs, saving you time and keeping your mockups authentic.


100+ Built-in Datasets

Choose from a wide range of pre-populated categories.


Customizable Lists

Create and manage your own custom lists to perfectly match your project's specific needs.


Sort & Randomize

Sort data alphabetically, by length, or randomize for unique content every time.


Number Formatting

Format numbers with precision. Control decimal places, separators, currency symbols, and percentage variations.


Date Formatting

Easily format dates with customizable separators and order.


Bookmarks

Save your favorite lists for quick and easy access.


How it Works

  1. Select the text layers you want to populate.
  2. Open DATVM.
  3. Choose a data category from the available lists or select a custom list.
  4. Customize formatting options.
  5. Click to populate the selected layers with data.
plugins.tagline: Finest Data Populator

plugins.name: Contrast Checker Pro
plugins.description:
🎨 Advanced Contrast Checker


🎨 Advanced Contrast Checker – Smart Contrast Analysis for Accessible Design


Take your design’s accessibility to the next level.


Advanced Contrast Checker: is a plugin built to detect and analyze contrast issues, even in complex scenarios like elements with **image backgrounds**.


🧠 Key Features:


1. 🎯 Accurate Detection


  1. Automatically identifies when an element has an **image as a background.
  2. Checks the layer hierarchy, scanning parent elements if necessary.


2. 📢 Clear and Visual Feedback


  1. Displays a prominent message when an image background is detected.
  2. Indicates that the contrast ratio is an approximation, offering a helpful reference.
  3. Includes visual icons for better clarity and user understanding.


3. 🌍 Multilingual Support


  1. Available in English, Spanish, and Chinese.
  2. Automatically switches language based on your Figma settings.


4. 🤖 Intelligent Behavior


  1. No color suggestions are shown when the background is an image.
  2. Uses a light gray approximation** to estimate contrast without misleading results.



Designed for creators who care about building **visually inclusive and accessible interfaces**, without compromising on precision or speed.


With 🎨 Advanced Contrast Checker accessibility becomes a natural part of your design workflow.
plugins.tagline: Smart contrast checking, even with image backgrounds.

138441.description:

🧠 Key Features:

138441.tagline: Smart contrast checking, even with image backgrounds.

plugins.name: FrameFlex - Frame Resizer & Scaler
plugins.description:
🔹 FrameFlex – Smart Frame Resizing for Figma 🎯

Manually resizing frames can be a nightmare — especially when things break.

FrameFlex is a Figma plugin built to help you intelligently scale mobile frames, while preserving structure and layout integrity (when properly set up). ✨


Here’s what FrameFlex can do:


🔁 Multi-frame support – Resize multiple mobile frames in one action.

📱 Device presets – Quickly apply popular mobile screen sizes like iPhone, Android, and more.

📐 Layout-aware resizing – Maintains Auto Layout, constraints, and alignment — if your design is structured correctly.

🔤 Element scaling – Adjusts font size, spacing, strokes, and other properties proportionally.

🎯 Icon/vector protection – Prevents scaling on specific elements to avoid distortion.

⚙️ Rounding controls – Use smart, grid, or exact rounding for clean results.


💡 The more Auto Layout you use, the better the results will be.

FrameFlex works best when your design is clean, consistent, and fully built with Auto Layout in mind.


✅ Focused on mobile-first workflows.

⚠️ Support for other frame types depends on how well they're structured.
plugins.tagline: Resize multiple frames. Preserve structure. Stay consistent.

137642.name: FrameFlex - Frame Resizer & Scaler
137642.description:

plugins.name: RouteMyPath
plugins.description:
RouteMyPath is a Figma plugin designed for runners, designers, and creators who want to bring their workout journeys into their visual work.


Upload a .gpx file from your running app (e.g., Strava, Garmin, etc.) and RouteMyPath will:

•Parse your route data

•Visualize it as editable vector paths

•Enable custom layout and styling in Figma


Ideal for designing performance recaps, social sharing visuals, or creating unique journey-based content right inside your Figma canvas.
plugins.tagline: A Figma plugin that turns your GPX route data into editable design elements

plugins.name: GIF Boss
plugins.description:
Bring your designs to life with GIF Boss — the ultimate Figma plugin for creating powerful, customisable GIFs in seconds. Select a series of frames and transform them into smooth, high-quality animations with full control over:

  1. Timing & Looping – Set frame durations and loop styles with ease
  2. Reordering – Drag and drop to perfect your frame sequence
  3. Optimisation – Shrink file sizes without compromising quality
  4. Bulk Creation – Generate several GIFs simultaneously. Ideal for large campaign roll-outs with multiple animated banner ads of different dimensions
plugins.tagline: Simultaneous multi GIF generation.

plugins.name: Detach variables
plugins.description:
Detacher – Take Full Control Over Figma Variables

Tired of wasting time manually detaching variables? Detacher is your all-in-one solution to quickly scan, preview, and detach variables from your selection — with full control and confidence.


✅ What Makes Detacher Better?


Visual Variable Summary

Instantly see how many variables (Colors, Text, Numbers, Others) exist in your selection, with a live count and total — at a glance.


Smart Selection Control

Choose exactly what you want to detach — Colors, Text, Numbers, Others, or Typography — using simple checkboxes.


Typography Variable Support

Detach all typography-related variables, including mixed styles and both string & number-based properties (like font size, line height, letter spacing, paragraph spacing, and indent).


Preview Before Detach 🛡️

Optional “Preview Changes” mode lets you review exactly what’s about to change — no accidental detaching, no surprises.


One-click Detach

Once you're ready, just hit the Detach Variables button and move on. No friction, no bloated UI, no hidden steps.


⚙️ How It Works

  1. Select your frame, group, or section.
  2. Launch the plugin.
  3. Pick the variable types you want to detach.
  4. Preview (optional) → Confirm → Done.


https://buymeacoffee.com/habeebrahman


Future-Proof & Community-Focused

We're continuously testing new scenarios, but bugs can happen — so please send your feedback 🙏

Exciting features are already in the pipeline!
plugins.tagline: Detach differnet types of variables in a frame effortlessly !

plugins.name: Swap Dimensions
plugins.description:
Missing the quick frame orientation swap button from the old Figma UI?

This plugin brings that handy feature back—fast and simple!


Swap Dimensions is a lightweight Figma plugin that lets you instantly flip the dimensions of any selected frame — from portrait to landscape or vice versa.


It also updates the Auto Layout direction accordingly, switching between horizontal and vertical when needed.


🪄 Perfect for responsive design, prototyping, or quickly testing layouts in different orientations — with a single click.


No UI, no setup — just select a frame and run the plugin.
plugins.tagline: The missing frame orientation toggle from Figma's old UI — back in one click.

136052.name: Swap Dimensions
136052.description:
Missing the quick frame orientation swap button from the old Figma UI?

This plugin brings that handy feature back—fast and simple!


Swap Dimensions is a lightweight Figma plugin that lets you instantly flip the dimensions of any selected frame — from portrait to landscape or vice versa.


It also updates the Auto Layout direction accordingly, switching between horizontal and vertical when needed.


🪄 Perfect for responsive design, prototyping, or quickly testing layouts in different orientations — with a single click.


No UI, no setup — just select a frame and run the plugin.
136052.tagline: The missing frame orientation toggle from Figma's old UI — back in one click.

plugins.name: Design Roaster
plugins.description:
Design Analyzer & Enhancer is your intelligent Figma assistant, designed to help you elevate your designs to the next level. With a single click, this plugin scans your entire Figma file, analyses your current design, and delivers a comprehensive review—including pros, cons, and actionable recommendations for improvement.

But that’s not all: inspired by your existing work, Design Analyzer & Enhancer also proposes an enhanced design concept, offering you a creative starting point for your next iteration. Whether you’re seeking a quick design audit or looking for fresh inspiration, this plugin empowers designers of all levels to create more polished, user-friendly, and visually compelling interfaces.

Key Features

• Automated Design Analysis: Instantly review your design’s strengths and areas for improvement.

• Actionable Recommendations: Get practical tips and suggestions tailored to your specific design.

• Proposed Enhanced Designs: Explore new design directions generated based on your current work.

• Easy to Use: One-click operation, no complex setup required.

• Boost Your Creativity: Use AI-powered insights to inspire your next great design.

• Transform your workflow, catch overlooked issues, and get inspired—all without leaving Figma.
plugins.tagline: Designer's companion for better UX/UI by ABA Bank

136990.description:

But that’s not all: inspired by your existing work, Design Analyzer & Enhancer also proposes an enhanced design concept, offering you a creative starting point for your next iteration. Whether you’re seeking a quick design audit or looking for fresh inspiration, this plugin empowers designers of all levels to create more polished, user-friendly, and visually compelling interfaces.

plugins.name: QuickData
plugins.description:
Easily sync your Figma layers with data from a public Google Sheet. Perfect for batch renaming or inserting text into layers based on column headers.


✅ 1. Prepare Your Google Sheet

Set it to public:

File → Share → Anyone with the link


Make sure the first row contains column headers


For best results, freeze the header row


⚙️ 2. In the Plugin

Paste your Google Sheet URL


Preview your data in a table


Use the refresh button to reload updated data


🧩 3. Setup Layers

Name your layers using: #ColumnName

e.g., For a "Name" column → #Name


Spaces & special characters are auto-removed


🔁 4. Sync Your Data

Select the layers you want to update


Click the “Sync” button


🖊️ Text layers: name & content will update


🧱 Other layers: only name updates


🙌 Support Me

If you found this plugin helpful, consider supporting me:

👉 https://jdip19.github.io/support-jdip.html


💬 Have Feedback or Ideas?

📧 Contact me: ujaydip9@gmail.com


🔗 Follow me on LinkedIn for UI/UX & plugin design updates:

linkedin.com/in/jaydip-upadhyay-32b231176
plugins.tagline: Auto-fill & rename text layers from Google Sheets

137348.name: QuickData
137348.description:
Easily sync your Figma layers with data from a public Google Sheet. Perfect for batch renaming or inserting text into layers based on column headers.


✅ 1. Prepare Your Google Sheet

Set it to public:

File → Share → Anyone with the link


Make sure the first row contains column headers


For best results, freeze the header row


⚙️ 2. In the Plugin

Paste your Google Sheet URL


Preview your data in a table


Use the refresh button to reload updated data


🧩 3. Setup Layers

Name your layers using: #ColumnName

e.g., For a "Name" column → #Name


Spaces & special characters are auto-removed


🔁 4. Sync Your Data

Select the layers you want to update


Click the “Sync” button


🖊️ Text layers: name & content will update


🧱 Other layers: only name updates


🙌 Support Me

If you found this plugin helpful, consider supporting me:

👉 https://jdip19.github.io/support-jdip.html


💬 Have Feedback or Ideas?

📧 Contact me: ujaydip9@gmail.com


🔗 Follow me on LinkedIn for UI/UX & plugin design updates:

linkedin.com/in/jaydip-upadhyay-32b231176
137348.release_notes:
## Version 2.0.0 (June 2025)

### Major Changes
- **Streamlined Data Syncing**
  - Simplified the core functionality to focus on direct Google Sheets integration
  - Improved data normalization for sheets with or without frozen headers
  - Enhanced error handling for invalid URLs and data formats

### UI Improvements
- **Tea Cup Animation**
  - Added animated steam effects with three particles
  - Implemented hover animations for the "Buy me tea" link
  - Refined positioning and styling of the tea cup SVG
  - Modified steam animation timing and positions

- **Instructions Modal**
  - Reorganized the "How to use" modal content for better clarity
  - Added clearer sections for:
    - Sheet preparation
    - Plugin usage
    - Layer syncing
  - Included tips about header rows and preview functionality

### Technical Improvements
- **Code Optimization**
  - Removed unused interfaces and functions for better maintainability
  - Streamlined the core data syncing logic
  - Improved error message handling
  - Enhanced logging for better debugging

### User Experience
- **Better Feedback**
  - Added clear success messages with layer count details
  - Improved error notifications with specific failure reasons
  - Added loading states during data fetch operations

### Documentation
- **Plugin Description**
  - Updated cover image text: "Instantly sync your Google Sheets data with Figma layers for seamless content updates"
  - Enhanced usage instructions and examples
137348.tagline: Auto-fill & rename text layers from Google Sheets

plugins.name: Disable "Clip content"
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin that disables the “Clip content” property on supported layers – either across the entire file or just the selected ones. Originally built for internal use at DevExpress, it helps reduce noise in exported SVGs by removing unnecessary <clipPath> wrappers and keeping the markup clean.


Repo: https://github.com/alexfi1in/figma-disable-clip-content
plugins.tagline: A simple plugin to turn off “Clip content” on selected layers or throughout the entire file.

133693.name: Disable "Clip content"
133693.description:
A Figma plugin that disables the “Clip content” property on supported layers – either across the entire file or just the selected ones. Originally built for internal use at DevExpress, it helps reduce noise in exported SVGs by removing unnecessary <clipPath> wrappers and keeping the markup clean.


Repo: https://github.com/alexfi1in/figma-disable-clip-content
133693.release_notes:
– Improved logging: the path to each modified clipsContent node is now printed in a structured, readable format with icons.
– Skipped clipsContent updates for INSTANCE nodes to avoid errors.
133693.tagline: A simple plugin to turn off “Clip content” on selected layers or throughout the entire file.

plugins.name: Pager
plugins.description:
Design-Ready File Templates in Seconds

Stop rebuilding your file structure every time.

Pager helps you spin up clean, structured Figma files with reusable templates built from your own component libraries or ours.


Whether you're starting a new product flow, setting up for research, or handing off to devs, Pager gives you a smart starting point so you can focus on design, not setup.


With Pager, you can:

Import full-page layouts from your published library components


  1. Use default templates for wireframes, UI, research, and more
  2. Create dynamic templates with text, boolean, and variant controls (Pro)
  3. Build faster with consistent, scalable structure


No setup? No problem.

Start from scratch or pick a default template.

Upgrade to Pager Pro anytime to sync your own library and automate your team’s workflow.


📚 View Documentation

🧩 Explore Example Templates
plugins.tagline: Go from blank canvas to design-ready in seconds.

plugins.name: SuperLayer (copy)
plugins.description:
SuperLayer (copy) lets you quickly view and copy the names of selected layers in your Figma file or FigJam board. It’s ideal for generating UI inventories, documentation, or simply organizing your layer structure. The plugin also shows each layer’s type and a thumbnail preview when available.


To use it, select one or more layers on your canvas and launch the plugin. A clean list view will appear with sorting options and checkboxes to include or exclude layers. Click the Copy button to copy all selected layer names to your clipboard, formatted line by line. The list updates automatically as you change your selection.


SuperLayer is optimized for speed and simplicity. It does not currently support exporting full metadata, nested hierarchy structures, or annotations. Thumbnails are generated when possible, but may not appear for certain FigJam elements or complex Figma nodes.
plugins.tagline: Copy Figma and FigJam layer names with ease. Sortable and perfect for docs, audits, and checklists

131488.name: SuperLayer (copy)
131488.description:
SuperLayer (copy) lets you quickly view and copy the names of selected layers in your Figma file or FigJam board. It’s ideal for generating UI inventories, documentation, or simply organizing your layer structure. The plugin also shows each layer’s type and a thumbnail preview when available.


To use it, select one or more layers on your canvas and launch the plugin. A clean list view will appear with sorting options and checkboxes to include or exclude layers. Click the Copy button to copy all selected layer names to your clipboard, formatted line by line. The list updates automatically as you change your selection.


SuperLayer is optimized for speed and simplicity. It does not currently support exporting full metadata, nested hierarchy structures, or annotations. Thumbnails are generated when possible, but may not appear for certain FigJam elements or complex Figma nodes.
131488.tagline: Copy Figma and FigJam layer names with ease. Sortable and perfect for docs, audits, and checklists

plugins.name: Randomize
plugins.description:
How it Works:


Select Text Layers: Choose one or more text layers on your Figma canvas that you want to modify.


Open Randomize: Run the Randomize plugin.


Enter Your Items: In the input field, type or paste the different text strings you want to use, making sure each item is separated by a comma (,). For example: John Doe, Jane Smith, Alex Johnson, Maria Garcia


Click Randomize: Press the "Randomize" button.


See the Magic: The plugin will instantly replace the content of each selected text layer with a randomly selected item from the list you provided.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly populate selected text layers with random content from your custom list.

129638.name: Randomize

Click Randomize: Press the "Randomize" button.


See the Magic: The plugin will instantly replace the content of each selected text layer with a randomly selected item from the list you provided.
129638.tagline: Effortlessly populate selected text layers with random content from your custom list.

plugins.name: Skeema
plugins.description:
What is Skeema?

Skeema is a Figma plugin that integrates API documentation directly into your design workspace. It allows frontend developers and designers to access API schemas for specific design components, making it easier to align designs with backend structures and speed up the development process.


How does Skeema work?

It connects your Figma designs to the relevant API documentation. By clicking on a design element, you can instantly view the associated endpoint documentation, eliminating the need to search through long API docs.


Who is Skeema for?

This plugin is designed for frontend and backend developers, and teams who work with API-driven applications. It helps bridge the gap between design and development, making UI-based API integration and collaboration smoother and more efficient.


What are the key benefits of using Skeema?

  1. 🚀 Faster API integration: No more switching between tools. Get API docs directly inside Figma.
  2. 🎯 Better accuracy: Ensure your design components match the API structures, reducing development errors.
  3. 👩‍💻 Streamlined collaboration: Designers and developers stay aligned, minimizing back-and-forth communication.


Do I need technical skills to use Skeema?

While Skeema is built with developers in mind, it's intuitive enough for designers to use as well. Its UI is designed to seamlessly integrate into your existing Figma workflow, making it accessible for anyone involved in the design and development process.


What APIs does Skeema support?

Skeema is designed to work with OpenAPI (Swagger) specifications, but it can support a wide range of RESTful APIs. As long as your API has proper documentation, Skeema can link it to your Figma designs.


Is Skeema free?

Skeema offers both a free version with basic features and a premium version with advanced features such as team collaboration, extended API support, and priority access to updates.


Can I use Skeema with my team?

Yes! Skeema is built for collaborative teams. You can easily share API-linked designs with your development team, ensuring that everyone stays on the same page and works with the latest API documentation.
plugins.tagline: Skeema integrates API documentation directly into your design workspace. Simply click to view docs.

plugins.name: Offgrid.fm
plugins.description:
Offgrid.fm is a lightweight Figma plugin that quietly monitors your design canvas and alerts you when someone is viewing your work without interacting. Whether you're collaborating on sensitive projects or just want more visibility into your workspace and helps you stay in control.


Key Features:

  1. Real-time detection of inactive observers
  2. Instantly identifies who's viewing your designs
  3. Helps protect your creative privacy and intellectual property
  4. Runs silently in the background without disrupting your workflow


Currently supports the Figma Web App only. *


Ideal for designers handling confidential work, remote teams, and creatives who value situational awareness in collaborative environments.
plugins.tagline: You've got eyes on you 👀

plugins.name: FileFlow
plugins.description:
FileFlow helps you instantly create organized file structures in Figma with predefined workflows for different project types.

Create consistent, well-structured Figma files without the tedious manual work. With FileFlow, you can:


Choose from pre-built templates for different workflows (Research, UI Design, Webflow, Product, Agency, and more)

  1. Create custom page hierarchies with intuitive organization
  2. Add sections and dividers to group related pages
  3. Use emoji icons to visually distinguish different page types
  4. Save time on project setup with one-click implementation


Perfect for teams that want to standardize their Figma file organization or individuals looking to streamline their workflow. FileFlow makes it easy to maintain clean, professional file structures that improve collaboration and productivity.


Tags

organization, workflow, file structure, pages, productivity, project management, templates, file setup

These details have been optimized for searchability while accurately describing what your plugin does. The description highlights key benefits and features that would appeal to Figma users looking for organization solutions. I've also included relevant tags that potential users might search for when looking for plugins like yours.
plugins.tagline: Organize your Figma files with custom page structures and workflows in one click

plugins.name: UIEditor-Exporter
plugins.description:
A utility plugin by Quicksave Interactive to make the workflow between Figma and the UI Editor a seamless experience.


This plugin allows you to export your Figma Designs to be used inside of the Quicksave UI Editor.


Be sure to read this to understand how to properly use this Exporter:


  1. Current supported UI Editor nodes are: Container, Text, Sprite.
  2. Figma's Fill and Strokes are converted to Sprite nodes (SVGs).
  3. Avoid having your UI bleeding outside their parent nodes.
  4. Keep a clear hierarchy and try to use descriptive and unique names for your nodes.
  5. You must save each image individually using the Exporter with the default name in the folder you specified. If you change these names / folders, you can update this in the UI Editor.
  6. If you encounter a missing feature, please email support for this plugin so we can look into it.
plugins.tagline: Exports Figma Designs to be used in Quicksave's UI Editor

122173.name: UIEditor-Exporter
122173.description:
A utility plugin by Quicksave Interactive to make the workflow between Figma and the UI Editor a seamless experience.


This plugin allows you to export your Figma Designs to be used inside of the Quicksave UI Editor.


Be sure to read this to understand how to properly use this Exporter:


  1. Current supported UI Editor nodes are: Container, Text, Sprite.
  2. Figma's Fill and Strokes are converted to Sprite nodes (SVGs).
  3. Avoid having your UI bleeding outside their parent nodes.
  4. Keep a clear hierarchy and try to use descriptive and unique names for your nodes.
  5. You must save each image individually using the Exporter with the default name in the folder you specified. If you change these names / folders, you can update this in the UI Editor.
  6. If you encounter a missing feature, please email support for this plugin so we can look into it.
122173.release_notes:
* UI Editor parentSize values will not exceed three decimal places after the export. 
* Text Node Horizontal Alignment and Vertical Alignment has been improved. A new container Node will be created per Text Node to ensure consistent Position and Alignment.
122173.tagline: Exports Figma Designs to be used in Quicksave's UI Editor

plugins.name: AVA Companion Plugin
plugins.description:
The AvaHub Batch Crop Importer plugin simplifies the design workflow by seamlessly importing crops generated by AvaHub.ai directly into Figma. AvaHub generates precise image crops, and this plugin allows you to batch import them effortlessly into your Figma workspace.


Simply upload the JSON file generated by AvaHub, and this plugin will take care of the rest, preparing all your crops for use in your Figma designs. Ideal for designers who work with dynamic content or need to quickly integrate various image assets.
plugins.tagline: A tool to batch crop your ava images

plugins.name: ProtoFlow – Offline Clickable Prototypes
plugins.description:
💡 Cos'è ProtoFlow?

ProtoFlow è un plugin gratuito per Figma che ti permette di esportare un prototipo interattivo cliccabile in locale, in formato HTML + PNG. Nessun hosting, nessuna connessione internet necessaria. Basta un browser.


Perfetto per:


Test utente su dispositivi embedded


Demo da inviare ai clienti


Presentazioni offline


Contesti in cui Figma non è accessibile


🚀 Come funziona


Seleziona uno o più frame da esportare.


Scegli il frame di partenza.


Risolvi eventuali errori o warning.


Clicca “Scarica prototipo”.


Viene generato un archivio .zip con:


start.html: il file principale da aprire in locale


screens/: la cartella con tutte le schermate e i file HTML


README.txt: guida completa all’utilizzo


🧠 Come sono gestite le interazioni?


Ogni collegamento tra frame in Figma diventa un link cliccabile nella pagina HTML.


Gli elementi con Navigate To + Instant vengono interpretati come hotspot.


Anche un’intera schermata può essere interattiva.


📦 Cosa contiene il file ZIP?


start.html: la pagina iniziale del prototipo


screens/: tutte le schermate in PNG + HTML per ogni frame


README.txt: istruzioni complete all’uso, anche per utenti non tecnici


⚠️ Importante: non rinominare o spostare screens/, né i file .html o .png, altrimenti i collegamenti si romperanno.


📘 Istruzioni integrate

Nel tab "Istruzioni" del plugin trovi una guida dettagliata. Puoi anche consultare il file README.txt incluso nell’archivio per avere una versione offline, utile da condividere con il tuo team o clienti.


🔐 Nessun dato viene inviato online.

Tutto il processo avviene localmente nel tuo browser. Le immagini e i file generati non lasciano mai il tuo computer.


👨‍💻 Creato da

Francesco Cerisano (Havas Milan)
plugins.tagline: Esporta prototipi cliccabili offline da Figma in HTML+PNG. Perfetto per test e demo

plugins.name: Section Auto-Resize with 200px Margin
plugins.description:
This plugin automatically resizes Figma Sections to fit their content and adds a 200px margin around the content area. It's designed to help teams maintain consistent spacing and layout rules without manually adjusting section boundaries.


Perfect for teams working with grid systems, spacing standards, or design system alignment workflows.
plugins.tagline: Auto-resize sections and apply consistent 200px margin padding.
